<!-- themes -->Love in its various forms acts as a major facilitator of [[interpersonal relationship]]s and, owing to its central psychological importance, is one of the most common themes in the [[creative arts]].
 
<!-- themes -->Love in its various forms acts as a major facilitator of [[interpersonal relationship]]s and, owing to its central psychological importance, is one of the most common themes in the [[creative arts]].
  +   +
[[Gilles Deleuze]] y [[Félix Guattari]] consider that [[capitalism]] produces a perversion of the natural love concept, by placing the human being as part of a production machine, and thus destructing the concept of body and soul.<ref name="Deleuze">Gilles Deleuze. Félix Guattari. ''[http://books.google.es/books?id=FQe7w8psqfQC&printsec=frontcover&source=gbs_ge_summary_r&cad=0#v=onepage&q&f=false El anti Edipo]''. 1972, 1985. ISBN 978-84-7509-329-1.</ref>
